intro: Siphonacanthus pubens, commonly known as the hairy siphonacanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, palmate leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and numerous stamens. Siphonacanthus pubens is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and wetlands.
